channel.title: [PI] Requesting help! [PI]
channel.description: I got this source and i need it to download the cache off my webhost like a webclient. The problem is the paths are set to link to the cache in the client folder itself. Where would i find all the places to change the paths and where would i get it to auto download the cache? I have AutoDownloadCache.java and it still does not download it... and my cache is uploaded

item.title: [PI] Requesting help! [PI]

@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

It goes to C:/… exactly

Read full topic

All people dont have Windows Vista or 7.[/quote]I have XP and it works for me… And for mac users its the same thing because my webclient does the same thing

item.title: [PI] Requesting help! [PI]
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

I am still getting the same error and this in my command prompt Directory doesnt exist, making directory Directory exists Directory exists Directory exists Directory exists java.io.FileNotFoundException: http://project-68.com/cache.zip at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(Unknown So urce) at CacheDownloader.downloadFile(CacheDownloader.java:109) at CacheDownloader.downloadCache(CacheDownloader.java:79) at client.startUp(client.java:7334) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:4790) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) UNZIP Directory exists

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Requesting help! [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Woopzpkedu Woopzpkedu
item.description:
@Woopzpkedu wrote:

wow u serious? in signlink.java search for public static String findcachedir() { and change it to public static String findcachedir() { boolean exists = (new File(System.getProperty("user.home") + "/Your_Client_Name_Cache/")).exists(); if (exists) { System.out.println("Directory exists"); return System.getProperty("user.home") + "/Your_Client_Name_Cache/"; } else { File f = new File(System.getProperty("user.home") + "/Your_Client_Name_Cache/"); f.mkdir(); System.out.println("Directory doesnt exist, making directory"); return System.getProperty("user.home") + "/Your_Client_Name_Cache/"; } }

where it says Your_Client_Name_Cache change it to your cache name

Read full topic
